Earth Hologenome Initiative | Gaun et al. 2025 The Earth Hologenome Initiative: Data Release 1 1 Introduction 1.1 Accession numbers 1.2 Prepare the R environment

Earth Hologenome Initiative | Gaun et al. 2025 The Earth Hologenome Initiative: Data Release 1 Nanna Gaun, Raphael Eisenhofer, Carlotta Pietroni, Garazi Martin-Bideguren, Jonas Lauritsen, Ostaizka Aizpurua, Joana Fernandes, Eduardo Ferreira, Fabien Aubret, Tom Sarraude, Constant Perry, Lucas Wauters, Claudia Romeo,, Martina Spada, Claudia Tranquillo, Alex O Sutton, Michael Griesser, Miya Warrington, Guillem Pérez i de Lanuza, Javier Abalos, Prem Aguilar, Ferrán de la Cruz, Javier Juste, Pedro Alonso, Jim Groombridge, Rebecca Louch, Kevin Ruhomaun, Sion Henshaw, Carlos Cabido, Ion Garin Barrio, Emina Šunje, Peter Hosner, Tobias Uller, Nathalie Feiner, Antton Alberdi1 2025-03-08 1 Introduction This webbook contains all the code used for the comparative study on the generation of metagenomic data from faeces of various species using three extraction methods. 1.1 Accession numbers The ENA accession numbers can be found in the sample and raw data metadata tables stored in the Gihub repository: https://github.com/earthhologenome/EHI_data_release_1/tree/main/data 1.2 Prepare the R environment 1.2.1 Environment To reproduce all the analyses locally, clone this repository in your computer using: RStudio > New Project > Version Control > Git And indicating the following git repository: https://github.com/earthhologenome/EHI_data_release_1.git Once the R project has been created, follow the instructions and code chunks shown in this webbook. 1.2.2 Libraries The following R packages are required for the data analysis. # Base library(R.utils) library(tidyverse) library(knitr) library(tidyverse) library(devtools) library(tinytable) library(rairtable) library(phyloseq) library(ggtree) library(ape) library(ggnewscale) library(ggtreeExtra) library(gridExtra) library(ggh4x) library(phytools) University of Copenhagen, antton.alberdi@sund.ku.dk↩︎
2 Metadata access 2.1 Raw dataset metadata 2.2 Sample metadata 2.3 Capture metadata 2.4 Specimen metadata 2.5 Sampling metadata 2.6 Host species metadata 2.7 Assembly metadata 2.8 Genome metadata

2 Metadata access Earth Hologenome Initiative metadata are stored in Airtable databases. Contents of those databases can be fetched using the R package raritable. However, data can be directly fetched only with personal access tokens. The relevant fraction of the EHI metadata is published on the EHI website www.earthhologenome.org/database. 2.0.1 Declare release EHI data releases are coded release="EHR01" 2.1 Raw dataset metadata List EHI dataset names included in the data release. datasets <- airtable("tblGyiZjOFa0skpV9", "appQpr6MxnaiVHsHy") %>% #get base ID from Airtable browser URL read_airtable(., fields = c("ID","Samples_flat"), id_to_col = TRUE) %>% #get 3 columns from MAGs table filter(ID==release) %>% pull(Samples_flat) %>% strsplit(split = ", ") %>% unlist() Fetch dataset preprocessing metadata containing some quantitative metrics of data composition and complexity. rawdata_preprocessing_metadata <- airtable("tblJfLRU2FIVz37Y1", "appQpr6MxnaiVHsHy") %>% read_airtable(., fields = c("EHI_plaintext","C","singlem_fraction"), id_to_col = TRUE) %>% select(-airtable_record_id) %>% filter(EHI_plaintext %in% datasets) %>% rename(rawdata_id=EHI_plaintext,microbial_fraction=singlem_fraction,nonpareil_completeness=C) %>% group_by(rawdata_id) %>% summarise(across(where(is.numeric), \(x) mean(x, na.rm = TRUE))) %>% mutate(microbial_fraction=ifelse(microbial_fraction == 0, NA, microbial_fraction), nonpareil_completeness=ifelse(nonpareil_completeness == 0, NA, nonpareil_completeness)) %>% as_tibble() Fetch dataset metadata and merge with the preprocessing table. rawdata_metadata <- airtable("tblaMWLkBUn2g5gRR", "appQpr6MxnaiVHsHy") %>% read_airtable(., fields = c("EHI_number","sample_alias","Total Data (GB)","Host Data (GB)","Metagenomic Data (GB)","ENA_experiment_accession","ENA_run_accession"), id_to_col = TRUE) %>% select(-airtable_record_id) %>% filter(EHI_number %in% datasets) %>% rename(rawdata_id=EHI_number,sample_id=sample_alias,total_gb=`Total Data (GB)`,host_gb=`Host Data (GB)`,metagenomic_gb=`Metagenomic Data (GB)`,accession_experiment=`ENA_experiment_accession`,accession_run=`ENA_run_accession`) %>% mutate(lowqual_gb=total_gb-host_gb-metagenomic_gb) %>% left_join(rawdata_preprocessing_metadata,by="rawdata_id") %>% group_by(rawdata_id,sample_id,accession_experiment,accession_run) %>% summarise(across(where(is.numeric), \(x) mean(x, na.rm = TRUE))) %>% as_tibble() # Write to table rawdata_metadata %>% write_tsv(file=str_c("data/",release,"_rawdata.tsv")) 2.2 Sample metadata Fetch metadata of the biological sample from which the DNA sequencing data were derived. sample_metadata <- airtable("tblW03Z3DcjRdEkoS", "appQpr6MxnaiVHsHy") %>% read_airtable(., fields = c("Code","captures_flat","Type","Origin","Freshness","Freezing","Datasets_flat","ENA_sample_accession"), id_to_col = TRUE) %>% select(-airtable_record_id) %>% #only retain samples associated with datasets filter(str_detect(Datasets_flat, paste(datasets, collapse = "|"))) %>% rename(sample_id=Code,capture_id=captures_flat,sample_type="Type",sample_origin="Origin",freshness="Freshness",time_to_freezing="Freezing",rawdata_id="Datasets_flat",accession="ENA_sample_accession") %>% as_tibble() %>% filter(lengths(sample_type) == 1) %>% mutate(sample_type=unlist(sample_type)) # Write to table sample_metadata %>% write_tsv(file=str_c("data/",release,"_sample.tsv")) 2.3 Capture metadata capture_metadata <- airtable("tbldKeYbUhEYC9NGQ", "appQpr6MxnaiVHsHy") %>% read_airtable(., fields = c("Capture ID code","specimen_id","sample_id_flat","Length (mm)","Weight (g)","Development"), id_to_col = TRUE) %>% select(-airtable_record_id) %>% #only retain samples associated with samples filter(str_detect(sample_id_flat, paste(sample_metadata$sample_id, collapse = "|"))) %>% rename(capture_id=`Capture ID code`,sample_id=sample_id_flat,animal_length="Length (mm)",animal_weight="Weight (g)",animal_development="Development") %>% as_tibble() # Write to table capture_metadata %>% write_tsv(file=str_c("data/",release,"_capture.tsv")) 2.4 Specimen metadata specimen_metadata <- airtable("tbl95ZvubrshwRyhD", "appQpr6MxnaiVHsHy") %>% read_airtable(., fields = c("Specimen ID Code","captures_flat","scientific_name","Sex"), id_to_col = TRUE) %>% select(-airtable_record_id) %>% #only retain samples associated with samples filter(str_detect(captures_flat, paste(capture_metadata$capture_id, collapse = "|"))) %>% rename(specimen_id=`Specimen ID Code`,capture_id=captures_flat,host_species=scientific_name,sex=Sex) %>% select(specimen_id,host_species,sex,capture_id) %>% as_tibble() %>% mutate(host_species=unlist(host_species)) # Write to table specimen_metadata %>% write_tsv(file=str_c("data/",release,"_specimen.tsv")) 2.5 Sampling metadata sampling_metadata <- airtable("tbl48d3HmXsRKwqv1", "appQpr6MxnaiVHsHy") %>% read_airtable(., fields = c("EHI event Code","captures_flat","Collaborator(s)","country_flat","Region","Place","Biome ontology","Environmental features","Date","Latitude reduced","Longitude reduced","Weather","Temperature"), id_to_col = TRUE) %>% select(-airtable_record_id) %>% #only retain samples associated with samples filter(str_detect(captures_flat, paste(capture_metadata$capture_id, collapse = "|"))) %>% rename(sampling_id=`EHI event Code`,capture_id=captures_flat,researcher=`Collaborator(s)`,country=country_flat,region=Region,place=Place,biome=`Biome ontology`,environment=`Environmental features`,date=Date,latitude=`Latitude reduced`,longitude=`Longitude reduced`,weather=Weather,temperature=Temperature) %>% as_tibble() %>% mutate(researcher = map_chr(researcher, ~ paste(.x, collapse = ","))) %>% mutate(biome=unlist(biome)) # Write to table sampling_metadata %>% write_tsv(file=str_c("data/",release,"_sampling.tsv")) 2.6 Host species metadata host_metadata <- airtable("tblaRHhZHRPMUjcKJ", "app6ADWyLxBkDcqYX") %>% read_airtable(., fields = c("Name","taxid","genus_flat","family_flat","order_flat","class_flat"), id_to_col = TRUE) %>% select(-airtable_record_id) %>% #only retain samples associated with samples filter(Name %in% unique(unlist(specimen_metadata$host_species))) %>% rename(host_species=Name,host_genus=genus_flat,host_family=family_flat,host_order=order_flat,host_class=class_flat) %>% as_tibble() # Write to table host_metadata %>% write_tsv(file=str_c("data/",release,"_host.tsv")) 2.7 Assembly metadata Fetch metadata of individual assemblies derived from the raw datasets. Note that co-assemblies encompassing multiple datasets are not included here. assembly_metadata <- airtable("tblG6ZIvkYN844I97", "appQpr6MxnaiVHsHy") %>% read_airtable(., fields = c("ID","EHI_number_api","Type (from AB Batch)","N50","L50","num_contigs","num_bins"), id_to_col = TRUE) %>% select(-airtable_record_id) %>% filter(EHI_number_api %in% datasets) %>% rename(assembly_id=ID,rawdata_id=EHI_number_api,assembly_type=`Type (from AB Batch)`,assembly_n50=N50,assembly_l50=L50,assembly_contigs=num_contigs) %>% #only retain individual assemblies filter(assembly_type == "Individual") %>% #only retain successful assemblies filter(assembly_contigs>0) %>% select(assembly_id,rawdata_id,assembly_n50,assembly_l50,assembly_contigs,num_bins) %>% as_tibble() # Write to table assembly_metadata %>% write_tsv(file=str_c("data/",release,"_assembly.tsv")) 2.8 Genome metadata Fetch metadata of metagenome-assembled genomes (MAGs) derived from individual assemblies. genome_metadata <- airtable("tblMzd3oyaJhdeQcs", "appWbHBNLE6iAsMRV") %>% read_airtable(., fields = c("ID","eha_number","GTDB_version","domain","phylum","class","order","family","genus","species","completeness","contamination","size","GC","N50","coding_density","contigs"), id_to_col = TRUE) %>% select(-airtable_record_id) %>% #only retain genomes associated with assemblies filter(eha_number %in% assembly_metadata$assembly_id) %>% rename(genome_id=ID,assembly_id=eha_number,genome_size=size,genome_gc=GC,genome_n50=N50) %>% as_tibble() # Write to table genome_metadata %>% write_tsv(file=str_c("data/",release,"_genome.tsv"))
3 Data statistics 3.1 Amount of data 3.2 Amount of samples 3.3 Sample type statistics 3.4 Country statistics 3.5 Environmental representation

3 Data statistics rawdata_metadata <- read_tsv(file=str_c("data/",release,"_rawdata.tsv")) #assembly_metadata <- read_tsv(file=str_c("data/",release,"_assembly.tsv")) #genome_metadata <- read_tsv(file=str_c("data/",release,"_genome.tsv")) sample_metadata <- read_tsv(file=str_c("data/",release,"_sample.tsv")) capture_metadata <- read_tsv(file=str_c("data/",release,"_capture.tsv")) specimen_metadata <- read_tsv(file=str_c("data/",release,"_specimen.tsv")) sampling_metadata <- read_tsv(file=str_c("data/",release,"_sampling.tsv")) host_metadata <- read_tsv(file=str_c("data/",release,"_host.tsv")) 3.1 Amount of data 3.1.1 Absolute total data rawdata_metadata %>% summarise(total=sum(total_gb),host=sum(host_gb),metagenomic=sum(metagenomic_gb),lowqual=sum(lowqual_gb)) %>% tt() .table td.tinytable_css_id1lk61rdcci8pw3d4l9ra, .table th.tinytable_css_id1lk61rdcci8pw3d4l9ra { border-bottom: solid 0.1em #d3d8dc; } total host metagenomic lowqual 5217.28 994.6583 3882.8 339.8216 3.1.2 Relative total data rawdata_metadata %>% summarise(total=sum(total_gb),host=sum(host_gb),metagenomic=sum(metagenomic_gb),lowqual=sum(lowqual_gb)) %>% mutate(host=host/total*100,metagenomic=metagenomic/total*100,lowqual=lowqual/total*100) %>% mutate(total=total/total*100) %>% tt() .table td.tinytable_css_idlt9gn2jcbcnbx8lhadu0, .table th.tinytable_css_idlt9gn2jcbcnbx8lhadu0 { border-bottom: solid 0.1em #d3d8dc; } total host metagenomic lowqual 100 19.06469 74.42192 6.513386 3.1.3 Per-sample data rawdata_metadata %>% summarise(total=mean(total_gb),sd(total_gb),host=mean(host_gb),metagenomic=mean(metagenomic_gb),lowqual=mean(lowqual_gb)) %>% tt() .table td.tinytable_css_idgabrntbm3ykasjkzhp0f, .table th.tinytable_css_idgabrntbm3ykasjkzhp0f { border-bottom: solid 0.1em #d3d8dc; } total sd(total_gb) host metagenomic lowqual 5.389752 3.838031 1.02754 4.011157 0.3510553 3.2 Amount of samples summary_table <- sampling_metadata %>% separate_rows(capture_id, sep = ", ") %>% right_join(capture_metadata,by="capture_id") %>% select(-capture_id) %>% right_join(specimen_metadata,by="specimen_id") %>% inner_join(host_metadata,by="host_species") %>% select(-capture_id) %>% separate_rows(sample_id, sep = ", ") %>% right_join(sample_metadata,by="sample_id") %>% select(-rawdata_id) %>% right_join(rawdata_metadata,by="sample_id") %>% separate_rows(rawdata_id, sep = ", ") %>% filter(rawdata_id %in% datasets) summary_table %>% group_by(host_species,host_order,host_class) %>% summarise(events=n_distinct(sampling_id),individuals=n_distinct(specimen_id),samples=n_distinct(sample_id),data=sum(total_gb)) %>% tt() .table td.tinytable_css_idnw7viajpszoauppgt96l, .table th.tinytable_css_idnw7viajpszoauppgt96l { border-bottom: solid 0.1em #d3d8dc; } host_species host_order host_class events individuals samples data Calotriton asper Caudata Amphibia 5 31 37 230.3935473 Canis familiaris Carnivora Mammalia 14 58 58 333.7068270 Chalcides striatus Squamata Lepidosauria 2 2 2 39.4685949 Geospizopsis unicolor Passeriformes Aves 1 2 2 27.1929588 Lepus europaeus Lagomorpha Mammalia 15 25 50 252.6467382 Lissotriton helveticus Caudata Amphibia 16 88 97 444.6582528 Natrix astreptophora Squamata Lepidosauria 2 2 2 32.8438776 Perisoreus infaustus Passeriformes Aves 3 3 3 38.4660147 Plecotus auritus Chiroptera Mammalia 1 2 2 42.1295469 Podarcis filfolensis Squamata Lepidosauria 9 43 43 174.6792330 Podarcis gaigeae Squamata Lepidosauria 17 61 61 303.4715766 Podarcis liolepis Squamata Lepidosauria 2 13 13 66.9840543 Podarcis milensis Squamata Lepidosauria 8 26 26 149.6805216 Podarcis muralis Squamata Lepidosauria 35 154 165 998.4877083 Podarcis pityusensis Squamata Lepidosauria 12 43 43 220.7678289 Psittacula echo Psittaciformes Aves 49 48 50 591.2283414 Salamandra atra Caudata Amphibia 1 2 2 23.8163316 Sciurus carolinensis Rodentia Mammalia 47 65 120 533.1140394 Sciurus vulgaris Rodentia Mammalia 76 74 123 660.4551216 Strix aluco Strigiformes Aves 1 1 1 3.7065531 Trichosurus vulpecula Diprotodontia Mammalia 2 2 2 20.8527879 Zonotrichia capensis Passeriformes Aves 1 2 2 27.9869136 NA NA NA 1 1 1 0.5422788 3.3 Sample type statistics summary_table %>% mutate(sample_type=ifelse(sample_type=="Skin swab: dorsal","Skin swab",sample_type), sample_type=ifelse(sample_type=="Skin swab: ventral","Skin swab",sample_type)) %>% group_by(sample_type) %>% summarise(samples=n()) %>% tt() .table td.tinytable_css_id1mg893a7awf8ng6lswei, .table th.tinytable_css_id1mg893a7awf8ng6lswei { border-bottom: solid 0.1em #d3d8dc; } sample_type samples Anal/cloacal swab 23 Colon contents 26 Faecal 894 Oral swab 13 Skin swab 6 Tissue 5 NA 1 3.4 Country statistics sampling_metadata %>% pull(country) %>% unique() %>% length() [1] 12 summary_table %>% group_by(country) %>% summarise(samples=n()) %>% tt() .table td.tinytable_css_iduh04rse3nx5dicbrrc6q, .table th.tinytable_css_iduh04rse3nx5dicbrrc6q { border-bottom: solid 0.1em #d3d8dc; } country samples Australia 6 Bosnia and Herzegovina 6 Ecuador 12 France 60 Greece 87 Greenland 58 Italy 271 Malta 43 Mauritius 61 Portugal 12 Spain 344 Sweden 7 NA 1 3.5 Environmental representation sampling_metadata %>% group_by(biome) %>% summarise(count = n()) %>% arrange(-count) %>% tt() .table td.tinytable_css_ida4gu5fiba62c8jgz4gvi, .table th.tinytable_css_ida4gu5fiba62c8jgz4gvi { border-bottom: solid 0.1em #d3d8dc; 4 Host tree Fetch all host species logged in the EHI database and output them into a texfile. airtable("tbl95ZvubrshwRyhD", "appQpr6MxnaiVHsHy") %>% read_airtable(., fields = "scientific_name", id_to_col = TRUE) %>% select(-airtable_record_id) %>% pull(scientific_name) %>% unlist() %>% unique() %>% write.table(.,file=str_c("data/",release,"_allhosts.txt"),row.names=FALSE,col.names=FALSE,quote=FALSE) Pull taxonomic metadata of all hosts. airtable("tbl95ZvubrshwRyhD", "appQpr6MxnaiVHsHy") %>% read_airtable(., fields = c("scientific_name","Family","Order","Class"), id_to_col = TRUE) %>% select(-airtable_record_id) %>% unlist() %>% write.table(.,file=str_c("data/",release,"_allhosts.tsv"),row.names=FALSE,col.names=FALSE,quote=FALSE) Generate a time-calibrated host tree in https://timetree.org and load it. all_host_tree <- read_tree(str_c("data/",release,"_allhosts.nwk")) ggtree(all_host_tree)
